bullets.text: U.S. will press Europe and allies to harden immigration policies amid mass migration concerns, signaling coordinated externalization push.
Colorado judge bars immigration arrests without judicial warrants in courthouses, curbing ICE operations and testing federal-state authority.
After D.C. shooting, Trump deploys 500 additional National Guard troops, expanding federal security footprint in the capital.
Trump says South Africa not invited to 2026 U.S. G20, risking diplomatic fallout and BRICS tensions.
U.S. warned Europe Russia is stockpiling missiles as fledgling Ukraine peace talks proceed; unusual Army Secretary role underscores urgency.
Georgia judge dismisses Trump election racketeering case, reshaping 2020 litigation landscape and potential 2025 campaign dynamics.
MIT: Existing AI could displace 11.7% of U.S. workforce; adoption constrained by costs and integration, not capability.
AI data center boom is lifting electricity demand and bills, stressing grids and complicating decarbonization timelines.
U.S. Medicare drug price negotiations threaten revenues for Novo Nordisk, AstraZeneca and European pharma, with global pricing spillovers.
Morgan Stanley touts Alphabet’s custom chip opportunity, boosting path toward $4T valuation amid AI infrastructure boom.
Apple poised to top Samsung in global smartphone shipments for first time in 14 years, reflecting premium demand resilience.
Uber and WeRide launch fully driverless robotaxis in Abu Dhabi, advancing commercial autonomy under favorable regulatory environment.
Singapore tops global talent competitiveness, driven by AI readiness; U.S. slips to 9th, signaling relative skills competitiveness erosion.
Stanford cell therapy cured type 1 diabetes in mice, offering regenerative approach that could reduce lifelong insulin dependence.
Voyager 1 nearing one light-day from Earth, marking historic milestone for human-made spacecraft exploration.
